intro: Centropogon delicatulus, commonly known as the delicate centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Centropogon delicatulus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
